result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerold J. Reible Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerold J. Reible Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:08 pm cases called. 15CM197, 15CM342, 15TR1334 & 15TR1335. Defendant Jerold J. Reible in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record by DA Blader. Attorney Szilagyi concurs. Waiver of potential conflict with DA Blader.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15TR1334-NC. 15CM197-No Contest. 15CM342-Count 2-No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright 15TR1335 & Count 1 of 15CM342. Court vacates the refusal. Court sentences the defendant to: 15TR1334-$811.50, 6 mo DL revocation, 12 mo IID, effective today. OWI Assessment. 15CM197 & 15CM342- SWD and places on probation for a period of 18 months. CONDITIONS: AODA and Follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample and surcharge. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states refusal issue and subsequent revocation. Requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.    Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

Case Called @ 1:23 PM: Defendant Jerold J. Reible in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing from WCJ via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues as to cash bond w/conditions.  SPD argues as to lower cash bond due to available funds to post cash.  The Court:  Appropriate to authorize a $250 Cash Bond w/Conditions.   NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  15CM-197 to track along with the new matter.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 09:50 am.
